title: How to Change Your Messenger Emoji Skin Tone: Easy Options

steps.title: Open a chat in Messenger.
steps.content: Open a chat in Messenger. Tap the name of a person in the list of chats to open an existing conversation with that person. To start a new chat, tap the Search bar at the top and then tap the name of the person you want to start a chat with.

steps.title: Tap the text box at the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the text box at the bottom of the screen. This opens the keyboard, which also has the option to select emojis.

steps.title: Tap the emoji icon.
steps.content: Tap the emoji icon. This displays the list of emojis. If you are using an Android, tap the icon that resembles a smiley face above the keyboard. If you are using an iPhone or iPad, tap the icon that resembles a smiley face at the bottom left side of the keyboard. If you are on a computer, click the smiley face icon to the right of the text box at the bottom of the Messenger window. If you’re on a phone or tablet, don’t tap the emoji icon to the right of the text box. This will open the Messenger app’s sticker and GIF menu, which no longer includes standard customizable emojis.

steps.title: Long-press the emoji you want to send.
steps.content: Long-press the emoji you want to send. On a computer, click and hold the emoji you want to send. On mobile devices, tap and hold the emoji you want to send. If the emoji has different skin tone options, it will display all the different skin tone options in a pop-up above the emoji when you long-press it. Not all emojis have the option to change skin tone. Most of the hand signals, faces with hair, and head and torso emojis can change skin tone. The yellow face emojis without hair cannot change skin tone. If skin tone options do not appear above the emoji you long-press, it does not have different skin tone options.

steps.title: Click or tap the emoji with the skin tone you want to send.
steps.content: Click or tap the emoji with the skin tone you want to send. This adds the emoji to your text message in your selected skin tone.

steps.title: Click or tap the send button .
steps.content: Click or tap the send button . It's the icon that resembles a paper airplane to the right of the text box at the bottom. This sends the message with your emoji to your recipient.

steps.title: Press and hold a message to select and customize a react emoji.
steps.content: Press and hold a message to select and customize a react emoji. In addition to changing the skin tones of emojis in your messages, you can also use emojis with custom skin tones when reacting to messages. Here’s how to do it: Press and hold a message to react to it. If you’re on a computer, hover over the message you want to react to and click the React button (it looks like a smiley face). Tap or click the + button. This will expand a full menu of emojis. Browse for an emoji with different skin tone options. Tap and hold or click and hold the emoji to display different skin tones. Tap or click the version of the emoji you want to use as a reaction. You can also customize your default set of common reaction emojis from this menu. To do so: After expanding the menu of React emojis, tap or click Customize under the Your reactions header at the top of the menu. Click or tap the reaction you want to customize, then browse for the emoji you want to use to replace it. Choose an emoji with different skin tone options. Tap and hold or click and hold the emoji to display the skin tones, then select the one you want. When you’re finished, tap or click Done or Save .

steps.title: Tap the ☰ in the Messenger app for Android.
steps.content: Tap the ☰ in the Messenger app for Android. It's in the upper-left corner next to "Chats." This opens your Messenger options menu. On Android devices, you can change the default emoji skin tone from within the settings on Messenger. As of October 2020, setting a global emoji skin tone on an iPhone, iPad, or computer is no longer possible. However, you can still select individual emoji skin tones when sending them. The option to set a global skin tone is only available on Android devices.

steps.title: Tap the Settings icon.
steps.content: Tap the Settings icon. It’s at the top of the menu, next to your name and profile picture.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Photos & media.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Photos & media . It's under the Preferences header, next to an icon that resembles a photograph. This opens the Photos & media menu.

steps.title: Tap Emoji.
steps.content: Tap Emoji . It's the third option in the Photos & media menu. This displays a pop-up with a thumbs-up emoji in various skin tones.

steps.title: Tap the emoji with your preferred skin tone.
steps.content: Tap the emoji with your preferred skin tone. This sets the emoji skin tone for all emojis that have different skin tone options. Every time you select an emoji, it will use the skin tone you selected, if available. You can always return to this menu to change your selection.
